comment: This is one of the worst classes at KSU. Grading guidelines are unclear and you get points off for stuff that wasn't even asked for in the project. Class is math based but your answers are ran through Turnitin. Quizzes/tests have a set time so ask for the date off or get off work earlier or you will fail. I had to take time off because of them.
Worst professor I have ever had. Grading guidelines are unclear. She doesn't care to teach. All in all, a terrible course to take.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: This professor puts least effort into teaching. Her classes are online YT videos. I don't even think this professor is still alive. She doesn't consider any missed home-works or any missed quizzes. She doesn't teach. She doesn't put in extra minute for her students. Just because her course is mandatory, people take this professor's course.
She puts least effort teaching but expects outstanding performance in weekly assignments and projects.

This professor is strict with deadlines and slow to give feedbacks. Uses a text book for weekly assignment regardless of your understanding of the previous topics. Mandates you to form a group (of about 4-5 persons) and carry out a project that is above the scope of the text book.  Avoid the course if you're a busy person with a busy mind.

Absolutely awful. VERY unclear in all instruction. VERY hard grader. VERY slow grader when she is VERY strict on due dates. Basically she is everything you dont want in a professor. Accepts zero late work (not even 1 minute late). Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment:
Even though the professor seems harsh, she is not. I am delighted with her class. I learned a lot. I am now thorough with each algorithm that she taught. If she was not strict with me to "learn," I would not have improved so much. 
She has a pure intention for students to learn perfectly. She gives good grades if you study well & do it correctly.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: **please avoid this professor** she does not give any explanation for her grading. She uses TurnItIn, which you have to remove questions from submitted assignments and change all the variables in your answers to avoid a false percentage, taking away from working on actual concepts. Her class averages are below 30% for quizzes and tests. ((AVOID))

Believe the other reviews. This professor is impossible to please. She will also promise one thing but then completely go back on her word. She also has asinine turnit policies that make no sense for a math-heavy course. There is a reason she has had disciplinary action in the previous semester.

I took her online Algorithm Analysis section and found that she grades solely by Turnitin similarity scores. In a math heavy course where students are expected to show work, this is unacceptable as math work gets flagged for similarity almost always since there is normally one correct way to do a problem, and it gets marked for plagiarism.

Unclear grading criteria, awful lectures, and incredibly standoffish when you email her about anything. Her tests are beyond awful, and she'll refuse to admit she's wrong until the entire class disproves her. Was nitpicky on the final project. It's almost like it hurts her to give students positive grades. One of the worst professors I've ever had.

I took the "elective" mobile app development class because I wanted to, but I hated it because of the professor. She deals with students as kids, she has an accent and she grades by your American accent, due to the pandemic we continued the class online and she was just posting videos for random videos from Youtube.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Disappointing! Should not be teaching a prerequisite class.

This professor makes the class more difficult than it should be. I was a pretty good student, had a 4.0 GPA until I took her class.. I was taking the class in person, last quiz of the semester was given online, I got confused on the time and missed the quiz then she won't reopen it.

This instructor is basically a grader. There are no lectures. She posts Youtube videos from random people to teach her class for her. Very picky grader. I can't believe this person is teaching graduate level courses. Actually she's not teaching. I wasted 3 weeks in this class.

Probably the worst CS professor that I have ever taken at Kennesaw State. Will take off 50% credit if she manages to break your app (and she will). Will give you a zero for a partially implemented app, no matter what her rubric may say. Wants a dozen useless toy features for the group project. She barely even teaches the class. Recommend against.

Her lectures are vague and the assignment requirements are worse. She is a tough inconsistent grader who confuses herself when giving feedback. She takes ALOT of points for minuscule things. I suggest you find a different professor or a different elective because the stress of her class is not worth it. Also, she's incredibly rude.

I had her for mobile dev and she was ok. There are labs due every week which you have to get checked off, three big hw assignments, and a semester long project. Start early! You basically have to design an entire app with three mobile features and present it. She's detail oriented as well, she's a little too good at finding small bugs in your app.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is not the best and not the worst. She below average. Get ready for a group project to developed a mobile app and her feedback is very harsh. You will have labs and no tests. Only homework(3), a huge project, (phases & due at the end), and labs. She will work with you on the labs just let her know you are having problems. Random attendance.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS
